verses.verse: Job Replies: I Am a Laughingstock Then Job answered:
“No doubt you are the people, and wisdom will die with you.
But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you. Who does not know such things as these?
(Job 16.10, 20; Ps 91.15) I am a laughingstock to my friends; I, who called upon God and he answered me, a just and blameless man, I am a laughingstock.
(Ps 123.4) Those at ease have contempt for misfortune, (Meaning of Heb uncertain) but it is ready for those whose feet are unstable.
(Job 9.24; 21.9; 22.18) The tents of robbers are at peace, and those who provoke God are secure, who bring their god in their hands. (Or whom God brought forth by his hand; meaning of Heb uncertain)
“But ask the animals, and they will teach you, the birds of the air, and they will tell you;
ask the plants of the earth, (Or speak to the earth) and they will teach you, and the fish of the sea will declare to you.
(Isa 41.20) Who among all these does not know that the hand of the LORD has done this?
(Job 27.3; Acts 17.28) In his hand is the life of every living thing and the breath of every human being.
(Job 34.3) Does not the ear test words as the palate tastes food?
(Job 32.7) Is wisdom with the aged and understanding in length of days?
(Job 9.4; 11.6) “With God (Heb him) are wisdom and strength; he has counsel and understanding.
(Job 19.10; 37.7) If he tears down, no one can rebuild; if he shuts someone in, no one can open up.
(Gen 7.11; 1 Kings 8.35) If he withholds the waters, they dry up; if he sends them out, they overwhelm the land.
(Job 13.7, 9) With him are strength and wisdom; the deceived and the deceiver are his.
(Job 3.14; 9.24) He leads counselors away stripped and makes fools of judges.
(Ps 116.16) He looses the sash of kings and binds a waistcloth on their loins.
He leads priests away stripped and overthrows the mighty.
(Job 32.9) He deprives of speech those who are trusted and takes away the discernment of the elders.
(Ps 107.40) He pours contempt on princes and looses the belt of the strong.
(Job 3.5; Dan 2.22; 1 Cor 4.5) He uncovers deep things from the darkness and brings deep darkness to light.
(Deut 12.20; Ps 78.61; 107.38; Isa 9.3; Jer 25.9) He makes nations great, then destroys them; he enlarges nations, then leads them away.
(Ps 107.40) He strips understanding from the leaders (Heb adds of the people) of the earth and makes them wander in a pathless waste.
(Ps 107.27) They grope in the dark without light; he makes them stagger like a drunkard.
